keyword: how many calories in a slice of banana bread
title: How Many Calories in a Slice of Banana Bread?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a slice of banana bread, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Slice of Banana Bread?
assumptions: Standard homemade slice (~60 g), made with ripe bananas, flour, sugar, eggs, butter; no nuts or add-ins.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, ingredients, and baking method. Check labels for store-bought varieties.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of banana bread contains about 250 kcal, with high carbs from bananas and sugar.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1/4 cup chopped walnuts per loaf (adds ~20 kcal per slice)
Use applesauce instead of butter (low-fat version, subtracts ~30 kcal per slice)
Gluten-free flour substitute (similar calories, but may vary by brand)

faqs.q: How many calories in a slice of banana bread?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for a standard 60 g slice.

faqs.q: Is banana bread high in sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, about 18 g sugars per slice from bananas and added sugar.

faqs.q: What's the protein in banana bread?
faqs.a: Around 3 g per slice, mostly from eggs and flour.

faqs.q: How does store-bought banana bread compare?
faqs.a: Often higher in calories (300+ kcal/slice) due to extra sugar and preservatives.

faqs.q: Can I make banana bread lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, substitute oil with yogurt or reduce sugar to cut ~50 kcal per slice.
